question: Arak Nuclear Reactor, which is currently being redeveloped, is in which country?
explanation: Iran has recently unveiled the redevelopment of part of its Arak heavy water reactor. Iran, as per the 2015 nuclear deal, had agreed to shut down the reactor at Arak, southwest of Tehran. The foreign governments who are part of the nuclear deal (UK, France, China, Germany and Russia) feel that it can be used to produce plutonium, which can be used in atom bombs.
